subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 12 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Players' union enters Barton row
The Professional Footballers' Association will try to end the row between Man City and Newcastle over Joey Barton's transfer.



 
McAteer opts to hang up his boots
Former Bolton, Liverpool and Republic of Ireland midfielder Jason McAteer announces his retirement.



 
Gibson targets big names for Boro
Middlesbrough chairman Steve Gibson is confident of signing some big-name players before the new season.








GOLF




Harrington confident for US Open
Padraig Harrington says the experience of winning the Irish Open could help him at the US Open, which starts on Thursday



 
Lyle backs Monty for US Open bid
Former Masters champion Sandy Lyle says Colin Montgomerie 'will not rest' until he wins a major.



 
Howell misses US Open with injury
David Howell pulls out of this week's US Open with a wrist injury.








MOTORSPORT




McLaren favour Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso says he has never been "completely comfortable" at McLaren because he feels they are giving preference to Lewis Hamilton.



 
Walker tips Hamilton for F1 title
Former commentator Murray Walker believes Briton Lewis Hamilton can win the Formula One World Championship.



 
Unscathed Kubica out of hospital
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica leaves hospital in Montreal after his horrific crash at the Canadian Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE




McLaren favour Hamilton - Alonso
Fernando Alonso says he has never been "completely comfortable" at McLaren because he feels they are giving preference to Lewis Hamilton.



 
Walker tips Hamilton for F1 title
Former commentator Murray Walker believes Briton Lewis Hamilton can win the Formula One World Championship.



 
Unscathed Kubica out of hospital
BMW Sauber driver Robert Kubica leaves hospital in Montreal after his horrific crash at the Canadian Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Pickering gets European Cup nod
Craig Pickering beats Mark Lewis-Francis to the 100m berth in Great Britain's team for the European Cup on 23-24 June.



 
Gillick sets new Irish 400m mark
David Gillick smashes the Irish 400m record at Switzerland's Atletica Geneve meeting.



 
Devonish delivers relay warning
Marlon Devonish says Britain should avoid rushing its next batch of sprint talent into the senior international arena.








CYCLING




Moreau replaces Wiggins as leader
Christophe Moreau wins stage two of the Dauphine Libere to replace Britain's Bradley Wiggins as overall leader.



 
Wiggins retains lead in Dauphine 
Britain's Bradley Wiggins retains a one-second overall lead after the first stage proper of the Dauphine Libere. 



 
Wiggins wins Dauphine time-trial
Britain's Bradley Wiggins gives his Tour de France prospects a boost by winning the prologue in the Dauphine Libere.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Ramon Calderon on David Beckham, plus Lewis Hamilton and Graham Taylor



 
Comment: Formula fun with Lewis
Robbo on Lewis Hamilton and the England cricket team



 
Ramprakash goes dancing again
Strictly Come Dancing star Mark Ramprakash breaks out a few of his best moves ahead of Surrey's Twenty20 campaign this summer.
